title: Y3shot
author: Y3shot
content: Their is no doubt that cryptocurrency has taking over the world, everyone is trying to develop a crypto project that will attract investors to invest in them. As the day counts by people are getting awareness of crypto project which they found it very nteresting to engage themselves with things that has to do with cryptocurrency. Their are lots of fake projects that people are investing in, and more fake projects are still coming and people will still found it interesting.  Bitcoin is the pioneer and footing behind other cryptocurrencies, tokens, NFTs, and airdrops that we have today. People will make mistake to invest in these project maybe because they lack understanding but with time they will correct their mistakes to turn back to bitcoin which is the best to invest. altcoins=>tokens=>airdrop>bitcoinAt the end of these exercises investors will turn to bitcoin as the best to invest because of it quality it has. When beginners are going the wrong way in investing cryptocurrency their is nothing that can be done to stop them but the experience they will go through their is a lot to learn from it to true back to the right thing which is bitcoin.

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: This makes sense!I can relate to this also because I remember before I was really lured to altcoins. Even I started with Bitcoin, like some of my Bitcoins before were converted to altcoins and I lost so much, after that I learned the lesson and started to hold and focus more on Bitcoin instead of altcoins.

comments.author: Mr. Magkaisa
comments.body: -   The spread of Bitcoin or cryptocurrency in different parts of the world is simply unstoppable in these times because financial investors know that we are in a bull run right now. So they also take advantage of an opportunity like this, and even with the airdrops of other platform protocols, they also do it because this is the right timing for them.But when the bear market season comes, the airdrops will gradually quiet down in the market, so what is happening is normal based on what I see.

comments.author: Solokan
comments.body: Bitcoin is the king of crypto and of course no one can beat it. However, yes, there are quite a few people who invest in Altcoins that are of poor quality with the aim of getting rich quickly, but those who are lucky will indeed get extraordinary profits and of course they will not give up on investing in Altcoins or others. However, those who experience losses will certainly give up on investing in Altcoins and will definitely end up investing in Bitcoin because they learn from experience and think that Bitcoin is the safest crypto.To be honest, I was also in a situation where I experienced losses due to investing in Altcoins that were not of good quality and up to now I believe Bitcoin is still the safest but I also invested in Altcoins but only a little but still the money I use most is to buy Bitcoin most of the because I personally have tasted the sweetness of investing in bitcoin.Yes, experience is a valuable teacher and indeed beginners sometimes experience losses when they invest because they are not investing in Bitcoin. However, experiencing bitter experiences has made some people realize that BTC is the best.

You have a point. These projects just prove why bitcoin is the king of all cryptocurrencies. In all these years even with newer technologies, bitcoin remains the best and not one has replicated its success. This further improves the confidence and trust people have on bitcoin. At the end of the day, bitcoin remains superior and one of a kind. It is safe to say that there will be nothing like bitcoin ever again.

comments.author: GideonGono
comments.body: I think it would depend on every traders, there are traders who would spread out their investment, and wouldn't focus on single trade to lessen the risk.But I do get the point all the other project mostly airdrop would only be used to make our portfolio grow bigger.

comments.author: Sam2589
comments.body: Yeah that’s true and I have experienced it too wherein we were lured to invest into new coins but ended up losing it all. It’s always better to stick to Bitcoin as I made a mistake in the past by investing my bitcoin gain into altcoins and I will never repeat it.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on May 30, 2024, 09:46:51 AMTheir is no doubt that cryptocurrency has taking over the world,Oh yes, there is!How many shops do you have around you that accept crypto?How many people invest in stocks and have a bank account and how many actually have a crypto address?Once you log out of this forum how many around you are actually interested in crypto?Taken over the world? Be serious!There are barely 40 million addresses with more than 1$ balance on the whole chain while we have 2 billion debit cards and you talk about "taking over the world"?Some people need a reality check, once you close twitter and other social media where you follow only crypto you will realize how large this world is and crypto has barely made a dent in it, it's a long long long way to go!!!

comments.author: Uhwuchukwu53
comments.body: Quote from: GideonGono on May 30, 2024, 12:49:10 PMI think it would depend on every traders, there are traders who would spread out their investment, and wouldn't focus on single trade to lessen the risk.But I do get the point all the other project mostly airdrop would only be used to make our portfolio grow bigger.Yes that true but the issue remain where one is spreading the investment how authentic it could be diversifying is not the issue but I don't see it as good means of cutting down risk as some may choose it.  Op point is very right the failure of some of this pump alter and shiltcoin has elevated BTC so much as many has see Bitcoin as the most preferable and it will still be reason been that the first impression speak louder than anything else.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: I disagree.Quote from: Y3shot on May 30, 2024, 09:46:51 AMaltcoins=>tokens=>airdrop>bitcoin Airdrop isn't a coin or token.What you want to say is: big cap altcoins > low cap altcoins > newly listed coins > Bitcoin.Some people might turn become Bitcoin investors, but if they hold their Bitcoin in centralized exchange and the CEX bankrupt, I doubt they will want to buy and hold Bitcoin again.Most likely the scenario is: Bitcoin > Big cap altcoins > low cap altcoins > newly listed coins > gold/stock/real estate. This is because they no longer believe in cryptocurrency and they think Bitcoin is same to other coins that scammed them.

Yes I agree with you, I see a lot of people even on the street this days discussing the success of cryptocurrency, some where even talking about NOTCOIN token that they had and how much value they've gotten so far, so for me the awareness about cryptocurrency is there already, but the unfortunate thing is that this awareness will make a lot of people invest in the wrong project because of peer pressure and lack of basic understanding of the crypto environment. comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on May 30, 2024, 01:24:14 PMThough i haven't been to every country,  but i will use my country to judge. Here we may not have shops, institutes that are accepting cryptocurrency, the government is not talking anything about cryptocurrency but I can say 70% of the young people are into cryptocurrency. I don't think people found cryptocurrency to be strange in my country. Quite the opposite, we do have businesses that accept crypto as payment method and the government is not sitting on the sidelines when it comes to crypto regulations either. The present government has managed to force Binance and other exchanges to stop p2p trading in the country. Even with all these challenges and restrictions, Nigerians are very keen on cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Stories about altcoin investors who are successful in achieving large profits whose value can change lives are interesting stories for many people to get directly involved in crypto because they want to experience the same success but also failures are stories that are also scattered around but usually people will focus more on success stories. that's why more and more people are getting to know cryptocurrency and after experiencing it first hand they will slowly start to get to know Bitcoin and realize that even though altcoins provide more open opportunities for big profits but storing Bitcoin is much safer, so yes the many projects that fail bring more people to know about crypto even though that is the worst part of cryptocurrency, because project failure is part of the scam in the crypto world.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: This is not entirely true in my opinion. Failed crypto projects only promote Bitcoin to those who have not given up after incurring losses. Many people condemn cryptocurrency, Bitcoin inclusive,  after the lose money through scam. It is only those who are able to do some findings and discover that not all cryptocurrencies are bad, that happens to stick to Bitcoin knowing that it is different from the rest. Some people I started with have shifted from Bitcoin to other areas siting risk and scam that are prevalent in cryptocurrency. If you actually know how many scams some of us suffer in this journey, then you will understand why they took those decisions. So while failed projects created strong Bitcoin believers, they actually scared a lot of people away from Bitcoin.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on May 30, 2024, 09:46:51 AMAt the end of these exercises investors will turn to bitcoin as the best to invest because of it quality it has. When beginners are going the wrong way in investing cryptocurrency their is nothing that can be done to stop them but the experience they will go through their is a lot to learn from it to true back to the right thing which is bitcoin. Many people who are investing in Bitcoin are attracted by the instant profit promised by some altcoin projects. These projects usually promise to give high profit that some greedy or uninformed people might not be able to resist the offer. When they are scammed, some of them will decide to leave the crypto space and never invest in the sector again. While others, through learning and experience, will come to realize that Bitcoin is the most reliable crypto. This might make them abandon altcoins and focus on only Bitcoin. It is just a two-way thing; a failed crypto project will discourage some people from investing. While others might decide to choose only Bitcoin because of a failed project. In reality, as many projects are failing, more are being launched and this enable people to jump from the one that has failed today to the one that will fail tomorrow and the cycle continues.Only a few will embrace only bitcoin or have the larger percentage of their portfolio in bitcoin while using the rest to gamble in altcoins.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Y3shot on May 30, 2024, 09:46:51 AMWhen beginners are going the wrong way in investing cryptocurrency their is nothing that can be done to stop them but the experience they will go through their is a lot to learn from it to true back to the right thing which is bitcoin. Talking about investment, we all have different views, of course Bitcoin has good value for everyone, including investors, but we cannot force investors to return to Bitcoin, actually they know the positive and negative things in investing, whether it's Bitcoin or other types of crypto.As far as I know, investors currently have high desires, minimal capital and want big profits, that's what Altcoins are, they know the risks faced by projects that could die without being able to return the initial capital, considering that the current price of Bitcoin is high, it is quite difficult to choose Bitcoin as a core investment, indeed Bitcoin should be an option, but this understanding makes many investors feel difficult because Bitcoin must have large capital.

Everyone has their own vision, if we look at what you are seeing this is clearly benefiting bitcoin. But there are also some other people who think that because there are so many scam projects created and that has caused many people to misunderstand that bitcoin is also one of them, and that is why many people call Bitcoin a scam.  Having many altcoin projects helps the market become more diverse and competitive, thereby giving investors more choices. But with many projects created but not strictly regulated, it leaves the market rife with scams and gives the cryptocurrency industry a bad reputation. So, it's hard to say that the failure of altcoin projects is a good thing for bitcoin.
